thread.title: State-run retirement plans future help retirees maximize Social Security

author: Sarah O'Brien
title: State-run retirement plans future help retirees maximize Social Security

organizations.name: georgetown university's center for retirement initiatives
maryland small business retirement savings board

text:
State-run retirement programs that automatically enroll private workers could help future retirees maximize their Social Security benefits, a new study suggests.

Based on projected account balances in 2050, 39 percent of participants in such auto-enrollment strategies would have enough to delay claiming Social Security by a year or more even at low contribution levels, according to
